subject: Data
title: The Privacy Paradox of Big Data
description: A quick win: understand The Privacy Paradox of Big Data.

hook.text: Researchers de-anonymized 'anonymous' Netflix viewing data by cross-referencing it with IMDB reviews.

buildup.text: Big data makes anonymity nearly impossible. Combining datasets can re-identify individuals.

discovery.text: Studies show that just four credit card purchases can uniquely identify 90% of people in a dataset.

twist.text: People willingly share data for convenience but are outraged when they learn how it's actually used.

climax.text: The privacy paradox: we want personalization but not surveillance â€” and big data delivers both.

punchline.text: In the big data age, anonymity is an illusion.

quiz.question: How many credit card purchases can uniquely identify 90% of people?
